CARDINAL . The relevant part of LAW of LAW reads as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) A person who , in the territory in which this LAW is applicable ... has sustained personal injury attributable to a wilful and unlawful attack upon himself or another person or the lawful prevention thereof shall , on application , be granted benefits in accordance with LAW on ORG in respect of resulting health impairments and financial loss . “
CARDINAL . LAW of FAC provides :

“ ( CARDINAL ) Where no decision has been made regarding an application for the performance of an administrative act within a reasonable time and without sufficient grounds , a court action shall be admissible DATE after an application for the performance of the administrative act has been submitted . ( ... )
( CARDINAL ) The same applies where no decision on an administrative appeal was made , providing that a DATE time - limit shall apply as a reasonable time limit . ”
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of FAC reads as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) On application by the insured person , the disabled person , the person entitled to benefits or his surviving dependants , a physician to be determined shall be heard as an expert . The hearing in respect of this expert opinion may be made dependant on whether the applicant advances the costs and , unless the court decides otherwise , the applicant in the end bears the costs .

( CARDINAL ) The court may reject an application where its admission would delay the settlement of the legal dispute and the court is convinced that the application was submitted in attempt to delay proceedings or the application was not submitted earlier due to gross negligence . ”
In view of the requirements of LAW of this provision , national courts in practice rarely reject such a request .
